name: votary
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
religion
  specialized a person who has made a promise to serve a particular religion or god: James Nayler was one of the most zealous votaries of Quakerism.
formal a person who strongly supports a particular cause or person: "How could you, a votary of non-violence, exhort others to take up arms and join this war?" he wrote to him.
More examplesFewer examplesBorges's story "Ragnarok," about false gods and the need to destroy them, is very probably derived from his contempt for the votaries of such idols.Theosophy, like every ancient philosophy, has its votaries among the moderns.I am a votary for greater wildlife tourism regulation.This kind of economic enables the votaries of the free market to come in and rewrite the rules, re-programming the behaviour of entire countries.
